What you'll learn: Why the field is exactly 120 yards long
Hash marks, yard lines, and field zones
End zones and their special rules

script.hook: Every football field looks the same for good reason. 120 yards of precisely marked territory that creates the game's strategy.

sections.title: The 120-Yard Layout
sections.content: Football fields are 120 yards total: 100 yards of playing field plus two 10-yard end zones. This isn't random - it creates perfect balance between offense and defense.
sections.onScreen: aerial field view + '100 yards + 20 yards end zones = 120 total'

sections.title: Yard Lines and Numbers
sections.content: The big numbers you see go from 10 to 50 to 10, not 10 to 100. They show distance to the nearest goal line. When you're at the 30, you're 30 yards from scoring - no matter which direction.

sections.title: Hash Marks Matter
sections.content: Those small lines every yard are hash marks. They determine where plays start - always between the hashes if the previous play ended outside them. This keeps plays in the middle third of the field.
sections.onScreen: hash marks highlighted + ball placement demonstration

sections.title: The Red Zone
sections.content: The 'red zone' isn't painted red - it's the area within 20 yards of the goal line. Offenses score touchdowns about 60% of the time here, which is why announcers get excited when teams enter it.
sections.onScreen: red zone highlighted + '20 yards to TD = red zone'

sections.title: Goal Line Rules
sections.content: The goal line is special - it's technically part of the end zone. This means if any part of the ball breaks the plane above that line, it's a touchdown instantly, even if the player gets tackled.
sections.onScreen: goal line cross-section + ball breaking plane animation

sections.title: Quick Recap
sections.content: Remember: 120 yards total, numbers show distance to score, hash marks center the action, red zone means scoring territory.

questions.question: How long is a football field from end zone to end zone?
questions.explanation: A football field is 120 yards total - 100 yards from goal line to goal line, plus two 10-yard end zones.

questions.question: What is the 'red zone' in football?
options: The middle 50 yards of the field
The area behind your own goal line
questions.explanation: The red zone is inside the opponent's 20-yard line. Offenses are expected to score when they reach this area because they're so close to the end zone.

questions.question: A team has the ball at their own 35-yard line. How many yards do they need to travel to score a touchdown?
questions.explanation: From your own 35-yard line, you need to travel 65 yards to reach the opponent's goal line (35 yards to midfield + 30 yards to their 20 = 65 yards total).

questions.question: Where is the 50-yard line located?
options: At midfield - halfway between both goal lines
50 yards from your own end zone
questions.explanation: The 50-yard line is at midfield - exactly in the middle of the 100-yard playing field, equidistant from both end zones.

keyTerms.definition: Small yard markers that determine where plays can start on each down
The area within 20 yards of the goal line where teams are likely to score
The line that separates the field from the end zone - breaking this plane scores points
